title: 113_s2005
content: The Act may be cited as the "Consumer Learning through Electronically-Accessible and Reasonable Cost Information Act of 2013" or the "CLEAR Cost Information Act of 2013." It involves the reporting of certain hospital payment data. The Social Security Act is being amended to update certain subparagraphs related to hospital payment data reporting. The Social Security Act is being amended to update hospital payment data reporting requirements for subsection (d) hospitals. These hospitals must report payment data to the Secretary in accordance with subsection (l), including data on amounts collected from uninsured individuals. Hospitals must submit data on amounts collected from uninsured and insured patients for the 50 most common diagnosis-related and ambulatory payment groups. Data reporting must be transparent to the public to benefit consumers. The Secretary shall post hospital data on collections and policies in a transparent manner on a publicly accessible website for consumer comparison by zip code. Subsection (d) hospitals must include a link to this data on their home website. The amendments made by this section regarding hospital data on collections and policies shall apply to contracts entered into, or renewed, on or after the date of the enactment of this Act. The Medicare Payment Advisory Commission's annual reports to Congress must now include information on the percentage of charity care provided by hospitals. Additionally, a report on charity care trends from certain hospitals will be made publicly available. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to require the Secretary of the Treasury to post data on a publicly accessible website for meaningful comparisons by zip code. Additionally, hospitals must provide a link to this data on their homepage as per Medicare requirements. Medicare now requires hospitals to include a link on their website to data posted under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act for meaningful comparisons by zip code. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act requires hospitals to include a link on their website to data for meaningful comparisons by zip code, effective for contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of the Act.
